Articles.Content: I recently installed EVE and upon starting it up, I'm getting this weird texture thing going on; EVE seems to have loaded BD Armory textures into the cloud. note: I am running ATM.

I am having an issue where EVE loads, but doesn't do anything in the game (with ATM) or crashes when it finishes loading (with no ATM). Also, is there a way to disable ATM on certain mods (Texturereplacer, for my skybox) so that it doesn't look like low res crap? Thank you all very much!

SmallFatFetus
I've seen this earlier today, apaprently there are atmospheric scattering shaders floating around.

Hope all is well with Rbray. By now I figure two things. He is gone from KSP for who knows how long. Possibly permanent. Or... Now dont get your hopes up. But what are the chances Squad is working with Rbray to secretly incorporate clouds for 1.0?

I've seen this earlier today, apaprently there are atmospheric scattering shaders floating around.

http://i.imgur.com/WSMYmF4.jpg

It's probably a photoshop. This picture originated on 4chan and was accused of being a photoshop over there. Of course, everything get accused of being a photoshop over on 4chan...

I've seen this earlier today, apaprently there are atmospheric scattering shaders floating around.

http://i.imgur.com/WSMYmF4.jpg

Where is it? I want it!

It's probably a photoshop. This picture originated on 4chan and was accused of being a photoshop over there. Of course, everything get accused of being a photoshop over on 4chan...

Looks shopped to me. Note the black pixels around the UI.

Looks shopped to me. Note the black pixels around the UI.

No, no, no. It is likely real, working, just not very well at all. I imagine it ruins the framerate. The black pixels, of which there are almost none, are most likely due to the fact the shaders where altered.

http://kerbalspace.tumblr.com/post/17827181033/the-story-of-ksp-ksp-0-4

http://kerbaldevteam.tumblr.com/post/86937174152/modding-mondays-astronomers-visual-pack

Search those pages for 'atmospheric scattering'. The game has it already so it wouldn't take much to enhance it a little.

Edited April 3, 2015 by Majorjim
Is this mod still being updated? I've gotten it to work in 0.90 but I'm wondering if the mod will be continued into 1.0...
So, does anybody know of a way possible to load compute shaders in KSP? I tried asking in the help section but no luck.
Clouds are way too thick on my install. How do I thin them out?

Clouds are way too thick on my install. How do I thin them out?

Delete layers if you have multiple layers. Otherwise lower the alpha value for the layer thats bothering you in the cloud.cfg file. You can also open the gui via Alt+N and make changes there. Don't forget to save you new settings once you're happy with them.

I have something wierd going on. My probe is splashed down on the night side of Eve with one panel under the water. The panel under the water seems to be getting a full charge from the sun as if the whole planet under the water is transparent. Is this something Eve could do or a bug in the core game?

Edited April 11, 2015 by tomf

I have something wierd going on. My probe is splashed down on the night side of Eve with one panel under the water. The panel under the water seems to be getting a full charge from the sun as if the whole planet under the water is transparent. Is this something Eve could do or a bug in the core game?

It's certainly not an E.V.E issue.

Here's hoping for some major work on the overhaul, which looks amazing, but only has clouds on kerbin last time I checked
Does any one know of any other cloud mods as this one hasn't been updated in a while.
Odd, it doesn't seem to be working on my system. Why aren't clouds stock again?

...but only has clouds on kerbin last time I checked

I'm pretty sure that's not a limitation of the new version but simply the fact that rbray hasn't had reason to config clouds for other planets while he's still working to get things right on Kerbin

Does any one know of any other cloud mods as this one hasn't been updated in a while.

Kerbal weather systems has clouds, I think, and the author is trying to make it run with 1.0 atmo intead of depending on FAR.
